result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D Wheeler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

----------------------------------------
AMENDMENT 10-16-2015 - IT IS HEREBY ORDERED PURSUANT TO ORDER OF THE COURT THAT DEFENDANT IS ENTITLED TO 220 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with all sentences now serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------

Pay Sheriff's fees in the amount of $105.00.
----------------------------

No contact wtih the victim without the victim's and Agent's consent.
-------------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Original filed with court
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Robert D Wheeler in court, in custody with attorney Ashley L Renz. Andrew Hermann appeared for the State of Wisconsin for ADA Diane Donohoo. 
Court in session @ 3:30 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on plea and sentencing. State is in compliance with victim rights. State has not received any response from the victim in this case. Court addresses medication issues from prior hearing. Attoreny Renz advises the Court that there are no medication issues today.
Attorney Renz states the agreement for the record. Plea questionnaire filed.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count #1.
Count #2 Dismissed and read- in.
Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant and finds factual basis for charges and for repeater enhancer. Parties stipulate to factual basis.
Court gives firearms warning, deportation warning, and voting warning.
Court finds the defendant freely, knowingly, and voluntarily entering plea and finds the defendant guilty of #1.
Attorney Renz requests the Court adopt the recommended agreement.
Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
Court makes and finding and adopts the recommendation of the parties. 
Court in recess. Minutes filed.

*TRANSCRIPT FILED 04/04/2016 - Court Reporter: Linda Matoska
Original filed with court.

1:33 Defendant Robert D Wheeler in custody in court with attorney Ashley L Renz. Prosecuting Atty Diane M. Donohoo appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Court raises the issue of the motion to suppress.  Statement by Atty Donohoo.  Has no objection to the Court signing the order.  Response by Atty Renz.  Court grants motion.
Atty Renz states her client is ready to plea except has missed some of his meds.  Court isn't comfortable with continuing.  Discussion.
Atty Donohoo asks court to remove the trial from the calendar and set the matter over for plea to avoid an appellate issue.  
Court cancels jury trial and sets plea/sentencing 6/18/15  at 3:30 p.m.
Writ to bring him back should include that medication is sent with him.
Court orders defendant returned to prison immediately.
1:48 pm

11:10 Defendant Robert D Wheeler appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Diane M. Donohoo appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Defendant Robert D Wheeler.
Motions in limine
Statement by Atty Renz.  Asks that motions be held until trial.
1- 2. Sequestration - granted as to both sides.
3.  Reference to punishment - granted.
4.  Preclusion to making reference to state's witness character without offer of proof first - granted applying to both.
5.  Preclusion of defendant offering other acts evidence of State's witnesses - granted
6.  Character reference as to truthfulness without offer of proof first - granted as to both sides.
7.  No attacking witness as to criminal matters without offer of proof first - to be dealt with later.
8.  Preclusion to arguing jury nullification - granted.
9.  Relevant evidence - to be dealt with during trial.
Other acts motion.  Argument by Atty Donohoo.  
Response by Atty Renz.
Court makes findings.  Finds all prongs for other acts evidence apply.  Motion granted.
PT - 5/28/15 at 1:30 p.m. for 1 hour
JT - 6/8-10/15 at 8:30 a.m.
11:48 am

Exhibit #1 - Copy of Criminal Complaint

Defendant Robert D Wheeler in court, in custody with attorney Ashley L Renz.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Appearances restated.  Discussion concerning whether this was a substitution of the preliminary hearing Judge.  Judge Koss makes a record that this was not a substitution but rather he was just stepping aside.  Preliminary hearing continues before Judge Reddy.  Testimony of Detective Bushey taken.  Exhibit #1 marked and discussed.  State rests.  No defense witnesses.  Argument by Attorney Donohoo and Attorney Renz.  Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over.  Arraignment scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.  

**01/15/2016 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Janet Schulz  (df)

Defendant Robert D Wheeler in court, in custody with attorney Ashley L Renz.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion between Attorneys and Court regarding a possible conflict in hearing this matter.  Defendant was previously charged and convicted in file 2009CF000509 when Judge Koss was then the District Attorney.  Defendant prefers that another Judge hear today's preliminary hearing.  Judge Koss steps down and Judge Reddy steps in for today's preliminary hearing.
